snippet: A man who for decades insisted that Chicago police officers had tortured him until he confessed to a 1982 rape he did not commit walked out of prison Wednesday after 30 years.
abstract: Chicago judge overturns conviction of Stanley Wrice, who has served 30 years in prison for rape he says he did not commit; Wrice claimed that he was tortured by police until he confessed.
lead_paragraph: A man who for decades insisted that Chicago police officers had tortured him until he confessed to a 1982 rape he did not commit walked out of prison Wednesday after 30 years.

headline.main: Illinois: Man Freed After Conviction Is Overturned
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Man Freed After Conviction is Overturned
